page.title: 01BADSWORTH
page.content:
Landscape Badsworth village
Badsworth is a small and very peaceful village with few amenities.It has a small primary school, a doctor's surgery,78 Club for adults,a sewage works out side Badsworth, a chapel and a church, and two bus services with the 485 to Wakefield and 246 to Pontefract.There used to be a Post Office.Badsworth is situated between Thorpe Audlin and Ackworth in West Yorkshire. In 1977 Badsworth came second in the best kept village competition.Farming is the only industry. I think it is nice and quiet but I think it is not for younger people,it is mostly for older retired people.
Christopher J Clarke Aged 13
